theme.summary: An economy or economic system consists of the production, distribution, consumption and trade of limited goods and services by different agents in a given geographical location. The economic agents can be individuals, businesses, organisations, or governments.
theme.title: Economy

theme.summary: An economy or economic system consists of the production, distribution, consumption and trade of limited goods and services by different agents in a given geographical location. The economic agents can be individuals, businesses, organisations, or governments.
theme.title: Economy

statistics.title: GDP quarter on quarter growth - CVM

theme.summary: Statistics in this area are related to the production and trade of good and services. These statistics are important for users looking to learn more about this section of the UK economy. Key statistics here are figures on retail sales, business activity, indices for the construction and manufacturing industries and international trade.
theme.title: Business, industry and trade

statistics.title: Trade in goods and services deficit (or surplus)

theme.summary: Labour market statistics tell us about people in and out of work. They cover a wide range of areas, such as: employment, unemployment, participation in the labour force, types of work, earnings, benefits, working patterns and workplace disputes.
theme.title: Employment and Labour market

theme.summary: Statistics in this area tell us a lot about the people living in the UK. From the level and growth in the population, to data and analysis on how households spend their money. We also have data on crime, divorce, diseases and religion here as well as much more. These statistics have a wide range of users and uses and they help us build a detailed picture of the country we live in.
theme.title: People, population and community

title: Home
intro:
###Welcome to the Office for National Statistics 
The UK's largest independent producer of official statistics and the recognised national statistical institute of the UK.
summary: The UK's largest independent producer of official statistics and the recognised national statistical institute of the UK.

releases.name: Population estimates
releases.description: Annual estimates of the size of the UK usually resident population are calculated at the mid-year point (30 June).

releases.name: Inflation and price indices
releases.description: Inflation measures the rate of increase in prices for goods and services using price indices.

releases.name: Drug use, alcohol and smoking
releases.description: Statistics on drug use, alcohol and smoking focus on deaths and illnesses related to these areas.

highlightedContent.name: What's coming and when?
highlightedContent.description: Find out when our statistics are released and sign-up to receive notifications.

highlightedContent.name: Other official statistics
highlightedContent.description: Find official statistics produced by other government departments.

highlightedContent.name: Looking for local statistics?
highlightedContent.description: A handy guide to let you know where to find local statistics.

highlightedContent.name: Census
highlightedContent.boxText: Who we are. How we live. What we do.
highlightedContent.description: Discover how our census statistics help paint a picture of the nation and how we live.

highlightedContent.name: Visual.ONS
highlightedContent.description: Visual.ONS is a website exploring new approaches to making ONS statistics accessible and relevant to a wide public audience.
